level.text: A Monte Carlo night party shall have at least the following workers:
Member-in-charge;
Deputy member-in-charge;
Pit boss;
Worker (dealer, croupier);
General cashier;
Assistant cashier; and
Prize pay-out recorder.
All Monte Carlo night party workers shall be at least eighteen (18) years old or older.
A Monte Carlo night party volunteer worker of the licensed organization shall wear a name tag.
A Monte Carlo night party worker who is employed by a licensed supplier to operate any Monte Carlo night party equipment shall register with the Board and wear a name tag.

No person employed by a licensed supplier to operate equipment at a Monte Carlo night party shall be registered with the Board if the person has been convicted of a felony or has not received a pardon or has not been released from parole or probation at least five (5) years prior to the date of the application.
Monte Carlo night party workers shall do the following:
Not accept tips;
Not play while working; and
Purchase chips or imitation money in the same manner as all other players.
1602 MONTE CARLO NIGHT PARTY GAMES AND EQUIPMENT
Only approved games of chance shall be permitted. Approved Monte Carlo night party equipment and games include all of the following:
All wheels;
Roulette;
All dice games;
Chip trays;
Twenty-one or blackjack;
Texas Hold’em;
Raffles conducted by a Monte Carlo night party license organization as set forth in § 1606;
Charity game tickets approved by the Agency. All unsold charity game tickets must be returned to the Agency representatives for destruction at the end of the event;
Any other Agency approved games;
The following games and equipment shall not be used at a Monte Carlo night party:
Horse race films;
Slot machines, penny fall money fall, bull dozer or similar type machines or devices;
The game of bingo or bingo equipment;
Poker and other card games where the players compete against each other, with the exception of Texas Hold’em as authorized by this chapter; and
Any other games not specifically approved by the Agency and not listed in § 1602.1.
